173.article_body: A clash broke out between anti-COVID vaccine mandate protesters and the police outside the Parliament in New Zealand's Wellington on Wednesday. The agitators reportedly set several tents on fire creating thick clouds of smoke in the air. The police used pepper spray on some of the protesters and started towing vehicles blocking the streets in the area.

174.title: 2 men arrested after police bust sex racket in Pune
174.article_body: The Pune City Police have arrested a 20-year-old man and a 26-year-old man from Jharkhand for allegedly operating a sex racket. The accused, Jayshankar Sav and Kuldip Mahto, were allegedly trafficking women from other states to Pune for flesh trade. Acting on a tip-off, police reportedly laid a trap at a hotel and arrested the alleged sex racketeers on Monday.

175.title: I used to plan my wicket celebrations, now I focus on making team win: Bumrah
175.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah has said that when he was a youngster he used to get "overexcited" and "plan his celebrations" after taking wickets. "[Now], I try to focus on the job at hand...When the team has won...there's ample time to celebrate...my focus is on making the team win," he added. Bumrah has been named vice-captain for Sri Lanka Tests.

176.title: Appalled but not surprised: Ashneer Grover on BharatPe's allegations of fraud
176.article_body: Ashneer Grover on Wednesday said he is appalled by BharatPe's allegations of fraud and financial misdoing for a "lavish lifestyle" after the company said he's no longer an employee, founder or director. "I am appalled at the personal nature of the company's statement, but not surprised," said Ashneer. "The only thing lavish about me is my dreams," he added.

177.title: Not mandatory to seek resignation of any minister until crime proven: Jayant Patil
177.article_body: Maharashtra minister Jayant Patil said it's not mandatory to seek the resignation of any minister until the crime is proven. His statement comes as NCP's Nawab Malik has been arrested by the ED in connection with a money laundering case. "If everyday some kind of action is being taken against ministers, it isn't mandatory to seek their resignation," Patil added.

178.title: Australia’s wildfires caused a 1% loss in ozone, finds study
178.article_body: The 2019-2020 Australian bushfires resulted in depletion of the ozone layer, a study has found. As per the study, smoke that rose into the atmosphere due to these wildfires resulted in a 1% loss of ozone, an amount that usually takes 10 years to recover. Scientists have warned rising wildfires due to climate change may slow down ozone recovery further.

179.title: 2 men rape woman on pretext of curing her of black magic in Palghar
179.article_body: A 20-year-old woman was allegedly raped by two men on pretext of curing her of black magic in Palghar last week. The woman alleged that the accused said she was facing problems because of a black magic spell cast on her and claimed they would perform magic tricks to cure her sufferings. When she followed their instructions, they raped her.

180.title: HC to issue directions on pleas seeking removal of marital rape exception
180.article_body: Delhi High Court has said that it will issue directions on March 2 on the batch of pleas seeking criminalisation of marital rape and reserved its verdict in the case. The petitions filed challenged the exception to Section 375, which exempts forced sexual intercourse by a man with his wife, from the criminal offence of rape.

181.title: I exploded on set, all actors became quiet: Bhansali on 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'
181.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali said that he once "exploded" on the set of 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' because he "wanted a certain atmosphere". "All the actors...became quiet. It was my way of giving those vibes to her [Alia]...Till date she doesn't know that this is what I did to get her into that space," he added.

182.title: Ukraine forces kill team of assassins who were plotting to murder President Zelenskyy
182.article_body: Head of Ukraine's National Security and Defense Council Oleksiy Danilov announced on television that a unit of Chechen assassins sent on a mission to murder Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has been "eliminated". "I can say that we received information from representatives of FSB (Russia's Federal Security Service) who have no desire to take part in this bloody war," Danilov added.

183.title: 2 men convicted for placing fence on railway tracks in Mumbai
183.article_body: A Mumbai court convicted two men in their thirties for placing a fence on railway tracks thus endangering lives. The accused had allegedly placed the fence between the Marine Lines and Charni Road railway stations in 2018. However, since they were arrested soon after the act, the court sentenced them to the period they had already undergone in custody.

184.title: 1 mn COVID vaccines expire in Guatemala as people refuse to take shot
184.article_body: Guatemala health authorities said over a million doses of Russia's Sputnik COVID-19 vaccine have expired because nobody was willing to take the shot. "We've tried to make available all the vaccines of different brands...Unfortunately, there has been a rejection among the public to vaccination," Health Minister Francisco Coma said, adding that the wasted shots cost the government about $11 million.

185.title: China conducts genocide, what more does Apple need to act: Meta ex-exec
185.article_body: Former Meta executive Alex Stamos in response to Apple's actions against Russia said, "The PRC [China] is conducting a genocide domestically; what more does Apple need to act?" "Apple has done more for...PRC than any other US tech company has done for any other authoritarian state," he added. Stamos said Apple prevents Chinese dissidents from installing secure messengers and VPNs.

186.title: Groundwater in rural areas in 31 Bihar districts contaminated: Economic Survey
186.article_body: Groundwater in rural areas in 31 out of 38 districts in Bihar is affected by arsenic, fluoride and iron contamination, state Economic Survey, 2021-2022, has revealed. "A total of 4,742 rural wards in 14 districts situated along the Ganga are...affected by arsenic contamination," the report added. The survey referred to the findings of the Public Health Engineering Department (PHED).

187.title: US First Lady Jill wears blue dress with sunflower in support of Ukraine
187.article_body: US First Lady Jill Biden wore a blue dress featuring an embroidered sunflower on the sleeve as a tribute to Ukraine amid Russia's invasion. Blue is one of the colours of the Ukrainian flag, while the sunflower is the national flower of the country. Earlier, a video showing a Ukrainian woman giving sunflower seeds to Russian soldier went viral.

188.title: Putin's closest friend Abramovich is panicking, wants to sell Chelsea: Swiss billionaire
188.article_body: Calling Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich one of Vladimir Putin's closest advisers and friends, Swiss billionaire Hansjorg Wyss said Abramovich is panicking like all other Russian oligarchs. "He's trying to sell all his properties in England. He also wants to get rid of Chelsea quickly," added Wyss. Wyss also said he has received an offer to buy the club from Abramovich.

189.title: Siblings on way to school hit by car with juvenile driver in Chandigarh
189.article_body: Two siblings, 17-year-old Jyoti and 15-year-old Suraj, were hit by a car being driven by a juvenile in Chandigarh's Mani Majra area on Tuesday. Jyoti suffered a fracture in one of her arms while Suraj received multiple injuries. The incident took place when the siblings were going to school. Police have started legal proceedings against the father of the driver.

190.title: Ashneer no longer a founder, his family engaged in misappropriation of funds: BharatPe
190.article_body: A day after BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover resigned as MD, BharatPe said in a statement on Wednesday that he is "no longer an employee, a founder, or a director of the company". BharatPe also alleged that Ashneer's "family and their relatives engaged in extensive misappropriation of company funds" and board reserves the right to take further legal action against him.

191.title: Husband had hernia surgery; he couldn't lift daughter for 2 months: Shriya
191.article_body: Actress Shriya Saran revealed her husband Andrei Koscheev had hernia surgery. Taking to Instagram, Shriya said that Andrei couldn't lift their daughter Radha for two months. Sharing a few pictures with her husband, Shriya wrote, "Thank you @theapollohospitals...for taking such good care of @andreikoscheev." Shriya also thanked actor Ram Charan's wife Upasana Kamineni Konidela, for helping them.

192.title: Japanese defence veterans volunteer to fight for Ukraine: Report
192.article_body: As many as 70 Japanese, including 50 former members of the country's Self-Defense Forces, have reportedly volunteered to fight for Ukraine against the Russian invasion. Ukraine's Embassy in Japan thanked the Japanese people in a social media post but said, "Any candidates for this must have experience in Japan's Self-Defence Forces or have undergone specialised training."

193.title: Middlesbrough knock out Spurs, Man Utd in consecutive rounds of FA Cup
193.article_body: Middlesbrough FC defeated Tottenham Hotspur 1-0 in their fifth round encounter of the FA Cup following a goal in the second half of extra time by Josh Coburn, having earlier knocked out Manchester United. United crashed out of the FA Cup after a 7-8 defeat on penalties in the fourth round, with Cristiano Ronaldo missing a penalty in the match.

194.title: IPL is the strongest T20 league: Usman Khawaja on IPL vs PSL debate
194.article_body: Sharing his opinion on debate over the better T20 league between IPL and PSL, Australian cricketer Usman Khawaja said IPL is the strongest league in the world adding that there's not really a contest. "They have all the world come to them and it is the only league in the world to have Indian cricketers," stated Khawaja.

195.title: When things are not going for you, people start talking: Harmanpreet Kaur
195.article_body: India Women ODI vice-captain Harmanpreet Kaur, who last scored an ODI ton in 2017, has said, "When things are not going for you, people start talking." Harmanpreet, however, also added her last two innings have given her a lot of confidence going into the Women's ODI World Cup. She scored a half-century and a century in her last two innings.

196.title: Delhi likely to receive light rainfall today and tomorrow: IMD
196.article_body: Delhi could expect light rainfall today and tomorrow due to western disturbance, the India Meteorological Department forecast showed. The maximum temperature in the national capital on Tuesday was at 26 degrees Celsius, which is likely to touch 28 degrees Celsius on Wednesday, the Met department said. Temperature in Delhi can go upto 30 degrees Celsius-mark by March 7, it added.

197.title: Sensex crashes 1,100 points, Nifty below 16,600 amid Russia-Ukraine war
197.article_body: The Sensex crashed around 1,100 points on Wednesday after crude oil price surged past $110 per barrel amid Russia-Ukraine war and India reported that its GDP growth slowed to 5.4% in Q3. The Sensex was trading below 55,200 levels, while the broader Nifty 50 fell over 270 points to trade below 16,600 levels.

198.title: Boeing suspends maintenance & technical support for Russian airlines
198.article_body: US planemaker Boeing said it's suspending "parts, maintenance and technical support for services for Russian airlines" as well as "major operations in Moscow". "As the [Ukraine-Russia] conflict continues, our teams are focused on ensuring the safety of our teammates in the region," a Boeing spokesperson said. Boeing on Monday had said it'd paused operations at its Moscow Training Campus.

199.title: Mumbai guard loses over a month's salary after wallet with ATM card stolen
199.article_body: A 62-year-old Mumbai-based security guard lost over ₹15,000, which is more than his month's salary, after his wallet along with ATM card was stolen while he was travelling on a local train, the police said. ATM PIN was written on the cover of the card, the complainant told police, adding that the thief withdrew the amount in three transactions.

200.title: Telangana records 152 new COVID-19 cases, highest in Hyderabad at 64
200.article_body: Telangana on Tuesday recorded 152 new COVID-19 cases, with Hyderabad reporting the highest number of cases at 64. Hyderabad was followed by the Mancherial district which reported 10 new cases. As many as 7,89,083 COVID-19 cases have been reported in Telangana so far. The state reported no COVID-19 deaths on Tuesday and the death toll so far remained at 4,111.

201.title: 'Jhund' breaks everything we have learnt in 20-30 years: Aamir Khan
201.article_body: Terming 'Jhund' as one of Amitabh Bachchan's "greatest films", Aamir Khan said, "I don't have words because it is a very surprising film. It breaks everything we've learnt in 20-30 years being in Bollywood." "I got up with a spirit and this film won't leave me," added Aamir. "It's very unique. I don't know how it got made," he stated.

202.title: It's my daughter's wedding: Pankaj Kapur confirms Sanah's wedding with Mayank
202.article_body: Actor Pankaj Kapur confirmed that his daughter Sanah Kapur is getting married. Sanah will tie the knot with actor Manoj Pahwa's son Mayank Pahwa in Mahabaleshwar on Wednesday. Speaking to a portal, Pankaj said, "I don't want to talk much about this, but yes it's my daughter’s wedding." Actor Vivaan Shah also shared a video from her pre-wedding celebrations.

203.title: 2 men open fire at wedding in Punjab, threaten lawyer with videos; booked
203.article_body: Punjab police booked two men for allegedly opening fire in air during a wedding function in Kakka village in November 2021. According to complaint registered against them, the accused filmed the act and threatened a lawyer who had a property dispute with them by sending him the video on phone. The duo was reportedly inebriated when the incident happened.

204.title: He'll never come back, please save those who are alive: Brother of Indian killed in Ukraine
204.article_body: The elder brother of Naveen SG, the fourth-year medical student from Karnataka who was killed in the war in Ukraine, has said, "My brother will never come back but please save those who are alive." "Many parents are spending every minute anxiously," he added. Naveen's father also urged the government to bring back stranded students in Ukraine.

205.title: David Warner performs hook step of 'Bachchhan Paandey' song, Akshay Kumar reacts
205.article_body: Australia batter David Warner took to Instagram to share a video of himself performing hook step of 'Maar Khayegaa' song from Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Bachchhan Paandey'. "How did I go @akshaykumar?" he wrote. "You've hit it out of the park brother," Akshay Kumar responded. "Friendship broken with Tollywood, now Bollywood is my best friend!" a fan jokingly commented on Warner's video.

206.title: 57 kg ganja seized from passengers on board trains entering Bengaluru
206.article_body: The Government Railway Police (GRP) in Bengaluru seized 57 kg ganja worth over ₹6 lakh from passengers on board the Howrah Express and Kakinada Express between February 24 and February 26. "The harvest season has begun for ganja grown in Odisha, Andhra Pradesh and hence we're seeing...surge in smuggling activity," GRP Superintendent, Karnataka, Siri Gowri, told The New Indian Express.

207.title: Hollywood actor Sean Penn escapes Ukraine on foot; shares pic
207.article_body: Hollywood actor Sean Penn shared a picture as he escaped Ukraine on foot. "Myself & two colleagues walked miles to the Polish border after abandoning our car," he wrote. "Almost all the cars in this photo carry women & children only, most without any sign of luggage, and a car their only possession of value," he added.

208.title: Kerala HC upholds ban on Malayalam news channel MediaOne TV
208.article_body: A division bench of Kerala High Court on Wednesday upheld the order on Malayalam news channel MediaOne TV's ban. HC dismissed the appeal filed by Madhyamam Broadcasting Limited, the channel's parent company, against the Union I&B Ministry's order to revoke the channel's licence. Centre had banned the telecast of MediaOne TV, which is backed by Jamaat-e-Islami, citing security reasons.

209.title: Ukraine President's wife shares pics of women amid war, pays tribute to them
209.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's wife Olena Zelenska took to Instagram to share pictures of Ukrainian women amid war. "Our current resistance has a particularly female face. My admiration and bow to you, incredible compatriots," she wrote. "Everything will be spring, everything will be victory, everything will be Ukraine!" she further wrote.

210.title: Music teacher didn’t think I was good, put me out of choir class: Usha
210.article_body: Singer Usha Uthup said her music teacher did not think she was "very good for music" and put her "out of choir class". "Years later...when I was performing...in Delhi, my music teacher was in audience. I dedicated a song...we had both cried," she said, adding, "It's not that I'm a good singer or a bad singer; I'm 100% original singer!"

211.title: Operation Ganga just a big photo op, lakhs evacuated during Gulf war: CPI(M)
211.article_body: CPI(M) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury called Operation Ganga, which aims to evacuate Indians stuck in Ukraine, a big photo op. "A big photo op session is going on for the last three days," he said. "India evacuated more than a lakh people during the Gulf War, over a lakh during the Libyan crisis but there were no photographs," he added.

212.title: Nike temporarily halts sales in Russia via its website, app
212.article_body: Nike is temporarily halting sales from its website and app in Russia, saying that it "cannot guarantee delivery of goods to customers in Russia". An update on its website directed customers to their nearest Nike stores. Ukrainian Member of Parliament Lesia Vasylenko praised Nike saying it's a "great example" of how private companies can impose sanctions against Russia.

213.title: Biden calls Ukrainians 'Iranians' during speech; video goes viral
213.article_body: US President Joe Biden called Ukrainians "Iranians" during his State of the Union speech on Tuesday, with the video going viral on social media. "Putin may circle Kyiv with tanks, but he'll never gain the hearts and souls of the Iranian people," Biden said. "Did I hear that incorrectly?" a social media user said.

214.title: Firm behind Free Fire app loses $132 bn in market value in 5 months
214.article_body: Singapore-based Sea Ltd, the owner of Garena Free Fire game, has lost $132 billion in market value from its peak last year in October. Its shares fell 13% in US trading on Tuesday, wiping $11 billion from its market valuation. Sea had earlier lost over $16 billion in its biggest daily market value drop after India banned Free Fire's app.

215.title: Apollo 24|7 launches One Tap consultations starting at just ₹250
215.article_body: Apollo announced one-tap consultation with their expert doctors using Apollo 24|7, along with round-the-clock consultation available even for minor illnesses at just ₹250. Users will benefit from Apollo 24|7 and no-one will have to take medicines without proper medical supervision, Apollo said, calling it a big step towards better healthcare in India. Users can download Apollo 24|7 app for free.

216.title: It won't be easy for Warner, Shaheen Afridi is good with new ball: Butt
216.article_body: Ex-Pakistan cricketer Salman Butt has said it won't be easy for Australia opener David Warner to open innings in Pakistan. "Shaheen Afridi is a good bowler...Warner survives in Australia because the ball doesn't seam that much. In Pakistan, the ball moves in the first session," he added. The first Test between Pakistan and Australia will begin on March 4.

217.title: WB CM Mamata Banerjee 'not abiding by the Constitution': Guv Dhankhar
217.article_body: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Tuesday said that CM Mamata Banerjee is "not abiding by the Constitution". "Under Article 167, the Governor has every right to question the state government...Mamata Banerjee for the last two years is not answering any queries of the Governor," he added. "It seems...Governor is the puppet of BJP," TMC MP Santanu Sen said.

218.title: I lost my on-screen virginity after kissing Kirti in 'Human': Shefali
218.article_body: Talking about her kiss with Kirti Kulhari in show 'Human', Shefali Shah said she lost her "on-screen virginity" as she had never kissed on-screen before. "I don't see it as being difficult because it's a woman. It was a true emotion," added Shefali. "I am terrified when I go on sets. I have a lot of self doubt," stated Shefali.

219.title: You've shown exemplary courage: Smriti Irani to Indian evacuees from Ukraine
219.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Wednesday welcomed the Indian students evacuated from Ukraine, in Delhi. "Welcome back home, your families are waiting with bated breath. You've shown exemplary courage," Irani said while interacting with the students as the flight landed at the Delhi airport. "Let's thank the flight crew as well," Irani added.

220.title: Govt was late in ordering evacuation of Indians from Ukraine: Chidambaram
220.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Tuesday said that the Centre was late in ordering the evacuation of Indians stranded in Ukraine. "The government was late in ordering evacuation. The government was also guilty of encouraging Indians to believe that nothing untoward was likely to happen in Ukraine," Chidambaram tweeted yesterday.

221.title: No migratory bird census at Harike wetland for first time in 11 years
221.article_body: For the first time in 11 years, the annual census of migratory birds descending upon Punjab's Harike wetland was not conducted due to COVID-19 pandemic. Migratory birds arrive at Harike wetland in the first week of November and stay till March. "As per the latest survey, around 80 species of migratory birds visited the wetland this year," an official said.

222.title: Ukraine's ambassador to US gets standing ovation at Biden's State of the Union
222.article_body: Ukrainian envoy Oksana Markarova received a standing ovation during President Joe Biden's first State of the Union address. "The Ukrainian Ambassador to the US is here...Let's...stand and send an unmistakable signal to the world, to Ukraine," Biden said. "She's bright, she's strong, she's resolved," he said about Markarova, who held a Ukrainian flag and placed her hand over her heart.

223.title: Was told blood went to heart during CPR due to work out: Bob Odenkirk
223.article_body: While talking about heart attack that he suffered last year in July, American actor Bob Odenkirk said that he was told that more blood was able to go to his heart during CPR because his veins were bigger due to his working out. "Because I was in good shape...you...enlarge veins around your heart...if you work out a lot," he said.

224.title: I had never stepped inside a gym before playing Black Widow: Scarlett
224.article_body: Actress Scarlett Johansson said she had "never" stepped inside a gym before being asked to portray the character of Natasha Romanoff/Black Widow in 2010 movie 'Iron Man 2'. "I had five weeks to prepare myself for these huge stunt sequences," added Scarlett. 'Iron Man 2' also starred Robert Downey Jr and Samuel L. Jackson.

225.title: More heat waves likely in northwest India during summer: IMD
225.article_body: The probability of heat waves over west-central and northwest India will be higher during summer, IMD Director General, Mrutyunjay Mohapatra, said. Normal or below normal heat conditions and lesser heat waves are likely during the upcoming summer season over large geographical areas covering the southern peninsula, central India, the northern plains, east and northeast India, IMD said.

226.title: I'd think to myself 'I'm going to die': Reynolds on battling anxiety
226.article_body: Actor Ryan Reynolds, who plays the lead role in the 'Deadpool' franchise, said, "I have had anxiety my whole life. I would be standing backstage...and I would think to myself 'I'm going to die'. Something horrible's going to happen." "The home that I grew in, that wasn't modelled for me really," added Reynolds who also starred in 'X-Men Origins: Wolverine'.

227.title: PWD to redevelop footpath near IP Flyover to make it pedestrian-friendly
227.article_body: In order to ensure pedestrian safety, the Public Works Department (PWD) is planning to redevelop the footpath from Indraprastha (IP) flyover to ITPO integrated tunnel works. "Currently, the footpath is not in...good condition. It is broken, uneven and two-wheelers often use it to escape traffic jams," an official said. The redevelopment project is estimated to cost ₹79.39 lakh.

228.title: US oil giant Exxon to exit its last Russian project, won't make new investments
228.article_body: American oil giant ExxonMobil will exit its last remaining oil and gas project in Russia and won't invest in new developments in Russia, following Ukraine's invasion. Exxon operates the Sakhalin-1 project on behalf of a consortium that includes Japanese, Indian and Russian companies. Exxon would end over a quarter-century of continuing business presence in Russia by quitting this project.

229.title: Won’t impose sanctions on Russia, want good relations with all: Mexico
229.article_body: The Mexican government said it will not impose any sanctions against Russia over its conflict with Ukraine as it wants to have good relations with all governments. "We want to be in a position to be able to speak with all parties to the conflict," said President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador. He further accused Twitter of censoring messages supporting Russia.

230.title: Novak Djokovic splits with coach Marian Vajda after 15 years
230.article_body: Novak Djokovic has parted ways with his coach Marian Vajda, who has been with the ex-world number one for the last 15 years and saw him win 20 Grand Slam titles. "Marian has been by my side during the most important and memorable moments in my career...While he might be leaving the professional team he'll always be family," said Djokovic.

231.title: Gangster who had been hiding in Thailand held on landing at Delhi airport
231.article_body: Delhi Police on Tuesday arrested a wanted gangster Virender Partap alias Kala Rana, who had been hiding in Thailand, after he landed at Delhi airport. He was running a syndicate in India from Thailand, police said. "Rana was carrying a reward of ₹1,00,000 for his arrest in connection with a case registered in Haryana," police added.

232.title: Mizoram sets up genome sequencing facility in govt hospital
232.article_body: A genome sequencing facility has been set up at the state-run Virus Research and Diagnostic Laboratory (VRDL) of Zoram Medical College in Mizoram. The laboratory is funded by a US-based organisation called Program for Appropriate Technology in Health (PATH), Health Minister Dr R Lalthangliana informed. Earlier the state's COVID-19 samples were sent to West Bengal's Kalyani for genome sequencing.

233.title: Russia kills our kids, now kill their App Store access: Ukraine Vice PM to Apple CEO
233.article_body: After Apple announced that it paused all its product sales in Russia, Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov wrote on Twitter, "(CEO) Tim Cook, let's finish the job and block App Store access in Russia." "They kill our children, now kill their access!" he said. Last week, Fedorov had written to Cook, asking Apple to cut services supply in Russia.

234.title: Despite 97%, he couldn't get a medical seat in India: Father of Indian killed in Ukraine
234.article_body: After 21-year-old Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar was killed in Ukraine's Kharkiv amid war with Russia, his father Shekharappa said despite scoring 97% in Class 12, his son couldn't get a medical seat in India. "It became inevitable for us to send him to Ukraine...but we lost him," he added. Naveen was a fourth-year MBBS student at Kharkiv National Medical University.

235.title: Many B'wood actors were 'allergic' to act in south remakes: Tusshar
235.article_body: Actor Tusshar Kapoor said earlier many actors in Bollywood had this "allergy" that they'll not do a South remake and will not work with a South director either. He added, "But now, most of these actors are open to doing remake films." Tusshar said he liked his father Jeetendra's remake films. "I'm not biased...I liked them all," he added.

236.title: Pakistani, Turkish students using Indian Flag to escape Ukraine: Indian students
236.article_body: Indian students who arrived in Romania from Ukraine said, "Pakistani and Turkish students are using Indian Flag to escape Ukraine amid the war." "Both Indian Flag and Indians were of great help to the Pakistani and Turkish students," they added. Earlier today, around 220 Indian students arrived in Delhi on a special flight via Istanbul.

237.title: I cut curtain, used spray colours to make Indian Flag: Indian student on escaping Ukraine
237.article_body: An Indian student who reached Bucharest in Romania after escaping Ukraine said, "I cut a curtain and used spray colours to make Indian Flag to paste on the bus." "We were easily given clearance due to Indian Flag," another student said. "Print out Indian Flag and paste prominently on vehicles and buses while travelling," Indian Embassy in Kyiv had said.

238.title: Never imagined I'll be alive: Indian student who left Ukraine's Kharkiv
238.article_body: An Indian student, Rupam Mondal, who managed to leave Ukraine's Kharkiv with friends by train said that there was continuous hurling of bombs and that they could not get out of bunker. "We were preparing food in hostel building when suddenly bombing started. It felt like earthquake. I never imagined I will be alive, it was really scary," Mondal said.

239.title: Husband demands fresh probe over wife's death in Maharashtra jail
239.article_body: Seeking a fresh probe over the death of Kanchan Nanavare in Maharashtra's Yerwada women's prison last year, her husband moved Bombay HC alleging negligence by jail authorities and lack of proper medical care. Kanchan was booked by the Maharashtra ATS in connection with a Maoist case in September 2014 and she died in jail on January 24, 2021.

240.title: Russia plans to introduce Belarusian troops into the war: Ukraine
240.article_body: Russia is preparing a "provocation" to justify the entry of Belarusian troops into the war, the Ukrainian Defence Ministry's Intelligence Unit said. "There are now about 300 Belarusian tanks near the Belarusian-Ukrainian border," it added. Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko on Tuesday said he's deploying more forces to the Ukraine border but denied having plans to join Russia's invasion.

241.title: Will PM Modi have the guts to tell Putin to back off: BJP's Swamy
241.article_body: Talking about the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict, Rajya Sabha MP Subramanian Swamy asked PM Narendra Modi to direct Russia to stop its military offensive. Taking to Twitter, Swamy said, "Now that it is clear that what Russia has done in Ukraine violates BRICS Resolution in Delhi Declaration of last year. Will Modi have the guts to tell Putin to back off?"

242.title: Ukraine-Russia talks unlikely on Wed, Russian demands unrealistic: Turkey
242.article_body: Turkey on Tuesday said Ukrainian and Russian delegations were unlikely to meet for planned talks on Wednesday, adding Moscow's demands to end the invasion were "unrealistic". The talks will "most likely be postponed a couple of days, we're in touch with the negotiating teams", Turkish Presidential Spokesman Ibrahim Kalin said. The first round of negotiations had taken place on Monday.

243.title: When someone says, 'Your time is done', it's hard: Karthik on Wriddhiman
243.article_body: Wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik has said Wriddhiman Saha has been a quiet servant of Indian cricket but now he needs to understand "where the selectors, the coach are coming from" in suggesting him to consider retirement. Karthik also added, "When somebody comes in and says, 'I think your time is done,' it can be a hard one to swallow."

244.title: Ankita Lokhande, Vicky Jain buy Mercedes worth ₹1.10 crore, pics surface
244.article_body: Actress Ankita Lokhande and her husband, businessman Vicky Jain, recently bought a Mercedes-Benz V220d. Taking to Instagram, photographer Viral Bhayani shared a video of the luxury car that arrived at Ankita and Vicky's house. In the video, Ankita along with her husband can be seen removing the cover from the car and is also seen cutting the cake to celebrate.

245.title: Russia’s demands must be addressed, sanctions illegal: China
245.article_body: China on Tuesday said that Russia's "legitimate security demands" owing to NATO's eastward expansion must be taken seriously and properly addressed. It also opposed the sanctions imposed on Moscow by various countries over its ongoing conflict with Ukraine. "We oppose all illegal unilateral sanctions. China and Russia will continue to carry out normal trade cooperation," said Chinese government.

246.title: Don't want to be most beautiful woman, but I'm not hot how I look: Shefali
246.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah said she has lot of self-doubts. "It's not like that I want to be most beautiful woman in the world but I am not hot the way I look," she said, adding, "I'm terrified when I go on sets...I have this...fear director is gonna say action and I'm...gonna stand there dumbfounded not knowing what to do."

247.title: WhatsApp banned 18.58 lakh Indian accounts in January: Report
247.article_body: WhatsApp banned 18.58 lakh Indian accounts in January based on complaints received from users and its own mechanism, according to its report. Meta-owned WhatsApp received grievances against 495 Indian accounts which appealed to ban 285 accounts, out of which 24 were banned. The majority of the accounts were banned for harmful behaviour detected through tools and resources deployed by WhatsApp.

248.title: Mumbai fire dept plans to get 6 fire engines equipped for congested areas
248.article_body: The Mumbai Fire Brigade Department is planning to get six new water tower vehicles that can reach a height of up to 18 metres. These vehicles will be beneficial in tackling fire incidences in densely populated areas and old chawls. Following the approval of the plan, the vehicles are expected to be delivered within 2-4 months.

249.title: 23-yr-old killed over affair with married woman by her brothers in Noida
249.article_body: A 23-year-old man was allegedly killed over suspicion of having an affair with a married woman by her brothers in Greater Noida, police said. "The brothers revealed...they saw the man at their home with their sister...brawl broke out...brothers said they strangled him to death," police added. Preliminary investigation showed the victim's body was thrown into the Ganga canal, police added.

250.title: Russian airborne troops land in Ukraine's Kharkiv, attack hospital
250.article_body: The Ukrainian army has said that Russian airborne troops have landed in the eastern city of Kharkiv. "Russian troops attacked a local hospital. There is an ongoing fight," the army added. At least 10 people were killed and 35 others were injured when Russian forces bombarded the central square in Kharkiv on Tuesday.

251.title: Indian man turns his basement restaurant in Kyiv into shelter home, provides free meals
251.article_body: Manish Dave, a 52-year-old man from Gujarat, has turned his basement restaurant named 'Saathiya' in Kyiv into a shelter home. Since the war broke out on Thursday, Dave has housed and fed more than 130 people at his restaurant. "I will continue to offer shelter and food [for free] for as long as I can," Dave told The Washington Post.

252.title: Two govt officials deployed to help Ukraine evacuees: Karnataka CM
252.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said efforts are on to bring back Kannadigas from Ukraine. "Two (government) officials have been deployed at Mumbai and New Delhi to help the state's people arriving from Ukraine reach their homes without any hassle," Bommai added. "The students in the north-eastern part of Ukraine are facing problems," Bommai told reporters.

253.title: Delhi govt invites expression of interest for 'Dilli Bazaar' portal
253.article_body: The Delhi government has invited expression of interest from agencies to design, develop, operate and maintain the 'Dilli Bazaar' e-commerce platform, including the online portal and offline services. The platform will help local businesses by providing them access to a global online community, Dialogue and Development Commission of Delhi Vice-Chairperson Jasmine Shah said.

254.title: I'm not iconic, Ukraine is iconic: Zelenskyy on becoming a wartime leader
254.article_body: During a CNN interview, Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy was asked about his journey from a comic actor to a global wartime leader, to which he responded, "It's very serious, it's not a movie." "I'm not iconic, I think Ukraine is iconic," Zelenskyy said. "Ukraine is the heart of Europe...[the] world can't lose this something special," he added.

255.title: Apple halts all product sales in Russia, days after Ukraine Vice PM's request
255.article_body: Apple has paused sale of its iPhone and other products in Russia, days after Ukraine's Vice PM Mykhailo Fedorov wrote to Apple CEO Tim Cook. Apple said state-controlled news outlets RT and Sputnik are no longer available on the App Store outside Russia. It has also stopped live traffic updates on Apple Maps in Ukraine as a safety measure.

256.title: Newborn girl's body with umbilical cord found in garbage dump in Gurugram
256.article_body: A newborn girl's body was found in garbage dump in Gurugram's Sector 52. Incident came to light when a passerby spotted body and alerted security guard. Security guard said body was wrapped in "blood-soaked cloth". Police said an umbilical cord was still attached to body. "It will become clear if the infant was stillborn after the autopsy," an officer said.

257.title: Some people say Putin has cancer, others say he has brain fog from COVID: Pelosi
257.article_body: During an interview, US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said, "I've talked to heads of state who have met with Russian President Vladimir Putin...Some say he has cancer and some people say brain fog from COVID-19. Other people just think he's a complete raging bully." Pelosi said this after she was asked if "something's wrong with Vladimir Putin".

258.title: 2 realtors shot dead in Telangana; police suspect business rivalry
258.article_body: Two realtors were shot dead in Telangana's Ranga Reddy district on Tuesday. The locals found a Mahindra Scorpio SUV from which blood was oozing out and alerted the police. One of the victims had died on the spot while the other succumbed to injuries during treatment. The police said it appeared to be a dispute arising out of business rivalry.

259.title: India reports 7,554 new COVID-19 cases; over 600 higher than yesterday
259.article_body: India has reported 7,554 new COVID-19 cases and 223 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 6,915 cases and 180 deaths. India's active caseload stands at 85,680, while the death toll in the country reached 5,14,246. Over 4.2 crore people have recovered so far.

260.title: Naxal killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada
260.article_body: A Naxal carrying a reward of ₹3 lakh on his head was killed in an encounter with the security personnel in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada district on Tuesday, a senior official said. The encounter took place between the DRG and Naxals in the forest near Tumkapal village. Following the encounter, police recovered a pistol, 5 kg IED, books and other materials.

261.title: Form special teams to identify govt teachers taking private tuitions: HC to TN govt
261.article_body: Madras HC's Madurai Bench directed Tamil Nadu government to form special teams to identify government teachers taking private tuitions or running private businesses. HC was hearing a government teacher's plea against dismissal of her request for transfer to another district. Common numbers must be provided for parents and students to file complaints regarding misconducts by teachers, HC directed.

262.title: I get to live beautiful things with you: Hailey on Justin's on 28th b'day
262.article_body: Model Hailey Bieber wished her husband, singer Justin Bieber, on his 28th birthday. Taking to Instagram, Hailey shared a few pictures with her husband and wrote, "Happy birthday my baby...there are a lot of amazing and beautiful things about this life, but the most beautiful part is that I get to live it with you. I love you...here's to 28."

263.title: Airbnb CEO says US sanctions affecting firm's Russian operations
263.article_body: Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky has said US sanctions on Russian banks have affected its ability to operate within the country. He added that a lot of their business will probably be halted "from the inability to be able to pay". Chesky also said that "all things are on the table right now" with regard to voluntarily limiting Airbnb's Russian operations.

264.title: 4 arrested for selling spurious ghee in Patanjali packs in Chandigarh
264.article_body: Chandigarh Police arrested three shopkeepers and a supplier for allegedly selling spurious ghee under packaging of popular brand Patanjali. Police raided the shops after the director of a company authorised by Patanjali to take action against shops selling spurious ghee under their name filed a complaint. The ghee was found to be made with a chemical unfit for human consumption.

265.title: Man sleeping on pavement killed after being run over by a tempo in Pune
265.article_body: A man sleeping on a pavement in Pune's Katraj was killed on Monday morning after the driver of a tempo ran the vehicle over him while on reverse. The police had arrested the accused, Sadashiv Chate, on Tuesday after going through CCTV camera footage. However, the driver was released on bail the same day by a local court, police said.

266.title: Naseem Shah added to Pakistan squad for 1st Test against Australia
266.article_body: Pakistan's 19-year-old pacer Naseem Shah, who was originally named as a reserve, has been included in the squad for their first Test against Australia after Haris Rauf was ruled out as he returned positive for COVID-19. Earlier, Faheem Ashraf and Hasan Ali were ruled out due to injuries, with Iftikhar Ahmed and Mohammad Wasim Jr being added to the squad.

267.title: Man stabbed to death after fight between 2 groups at Delhi gym
267.article_body: A man was allegedly stabbed to death at a gym in Delhi's Paharganj after a fight broke out between two groups. "There was an incident of a fight inside a gym between two boys, who also called their families," police said giving details. "The fight got aggravated and one party attacked the other with a knife killing one," they added.

268.title: Online forum, man booked over posts against HC judge in Bengaluru
268.article_body: The Bengaluru Police registered a case against an online forum Mangalore Muslims and Ateeq Shariff for allegedly posting against a High Court judge who is hearing the hijab case. The Facebook posts were derogatory and cast aspersions on the independence of the judge, the police said. Earlier, Kannada actor Chetan Kumar Ahimsa was arrested for posting against the same judge.

269.title: 80-year-old man lights his own pyre, dies in Nagpur
269.article_body: An 80-year-old man reportedly killed himself by lighting his own pyre in Nagpur. According to family of the deceased, identified as Atmaram Motiram Thawkar, he had a trachea surgery in 2006 from which he never fully recovered. Based on initial probe, police said Thawkar performed puja at a village temple and then built a pyre in a field using firewood.

270.title: Police scale wall to rescue woman, kids locked by her husband in Gujarat
270.article_body: Gujarat Police scaled walls of house to rescue woman and her children who had been locked by woman's husband. The husband reportedly locked them up after woman insisted on attending the last rites of her grandfather. Reports said husband also threatened to attack them with sharp objects. Woman asked for help from balcony. Police then reached woman's room through balcony.

271.title: I lost 7-kg weight during South Africa tour due to infection: Shreyas Iyer
271.article_body: Batter Shreyas Iyer has revealed that he lost 7-kg weight during India's tour of South Africa in December-January. "I had a very bad stomach infection at the start of the year when we were in South Africa.  Basically, whatever I was eating, it was coming out. It was one of the worst phases of my life," Iyer said.

272.title: Ex-BJP MP alleges 4 people known to him kidnapped from outside Delhi home
272.article_body: Senior BJP leader AP Jithender Reddy alleged four of his acquaintances, including a personal driver, were abducted from outside his Delhi residence on Monday. Reddy, a former MP from Mahbubnagar, was in Hyderabad at the time of the alleged incident. In a video shared by Reddy, five-seven men can purportedly be seen forcing the men to get inside a car.

273.title: We will seize Russian billionaires' yachts, luxury apartments, private jets: Biden
273.article_body: During the State of the Union speech on Tuesday, US President Joe Biden said that the US along with European allies will seize Russian billionaires' yachts, their luxury apartments and their private jets. "The United States...is assembling a dedicated task force to go after the crimes of the Russian oligarchs," he further said.

274.title: US and allies making Putin's $630 billion war funds 'worthless': Joe Biden
274.article_body: US President Joe Biden in his State of the Union address said that US and its allies are making "Putin's $630 billion war fund worthless" by preventing Russia's central bank from defending the Russian ruble. "We're choking off Russia's access to technology that will sap its economic strength and weaken its military for years to come," he added.

275.title: Putin thought he could roll into Ukraine, but he badly miscalculated: Biden
275.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Tuesday night said that Russian President Vladimir Putin "badly miscalculated" with his invasion of Ukraine. "He thought he could roll into Ukraine and the world would roll over. Instead he met a wall of strength he never anticipated or imagined. He met the Ukrainian people," Biden said of Putin.

276.title: Russia carries out nuclear submarine drills in Barents Sea
276.article_body: Russia carried out nuclear submarine drills at Barents Sea, days after President Vladimir Putin ordered his country's nuclear forces to be put on high alert amid invasion of Ukraine. Russia's Northern Fleet said in a statement that its nuclear submarines were involved in exercises designed to "train manoeuvring in stormy conditions". The Russia-Ukraine war entered its seventh day today.

277.title: Karnataka reports 202 new COVID-19 cases; 150 in Bengaluru alone
277.article_body: Karnataka reported 202 new coronavirus cases on Tuesday, according to data provided by the state health department. Of the new cases, 150 were reported from the state capital, Bengaluru, alone. The state also reported seven more coronavirus-related deaths, out of which three were reported from Bengaluru. The total number of active coronavirus cases in the city now stands at 3,003.

278.title: 7 Pimpri-Chinchwad police recruitment exam candidates booked for cheating
278.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad police has booked seven candidates who appeared for 2019 Pimpri-Chinchwad police recruitment examination. They were booked after their documents were found to be fake after they were sent for verification to a scrutiny committee. The police have not arrested anyone in the case yet. Police said the cheating happened between November 18, 2021 and January 5, 2022.

279.title: US closes airspace to all Russian aircraft, Biden says 'Putin has no idea what's coming'
279.article_body: US President Joe Biden has announced that the country is closing its airspace to all Russian aircraft. "It will further isolate Russia and add additional squeeze on their economy...Vladimir Putin has no idea what's coming," Biden said. Biden added that the US would join its allies in coming after Russia's oligarchs and seizing their yachts, luxury apartments and private jets.

280.title: Big B cut his fee, said 'spend it on film instead of me': 'Jhund' producer
280.article_body: Producer of the film 'Jhund', Sandeep Singh, said that the film had a "modest budget" and that they were figuring out how to bring actor Amitabh Bachchan on board. "Mr Bachchan loved the script...he stunned us by cutting down on his fee...He said, 'Instead of spending on me, let's spend on the film'...His staff too slashed their fees," Sandeep said.

281.title: Russian crimes are mounting by hour in Ukraine: US Secy of State
281.article_body: Russian "crimes" in Ukraine are mounting by the hour, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken told the UN Human Rights Council on Tuesday. "Russian strikes are hitting schools, hospitals, and residential buildings," he said. Russia has faced criticism from the West over its invasion of Ukraine, which has sparked a refugee crisis.

282.title: Dismantling of 800-bed COVID hospital in Pune's Shivajinagar begins
282.article_body: The dismantling of the jumbo COVID-19 hospital at the College of Engineering Pune (COEP) ground in Shivajinagar has begun. The 800-bed hospital treated at least 3,000 patients in two years of its service. The contract of the hospital, which was set up at the initial cost of ₹75 crore, will end on March 28.

283.title: 2 men sexually assault 16-yr-old male domestic help in Gurugram
283.article_body: Two men have been booked by police for allegedly sexually assaulting a 16-year-old boy who worked as domestic help in Haryana's Gurugram. Investigation into the incident, which reportedly took place in June 2020, revealed that the boy's employer and one of his friends sexually assaulted him. Police said that the two accused went into hiding after committing the offence.

284.title: Man held for setting 29-yr-old's body on fire in Mumbai's Antop Hill
284.article_body: Police have arrested a man for allegedly killing a 29-year-old man and setting his body on fire to destroy evidence in Mumbai's Antop Hill area. The arrest was made after police found a partially charred dead body in the area. Police said the accused had placed a mosquito coil near the body to make it look like an "accidental death".

285.title: IAF aircraft on standby for evacuation of Indians from Ukraine
285.article_body: The Indian Air Force has put its aircraft on standby for 'Operation Ganga' under which Indian nationals will be evacuated from the war-hit Ukraine, officials said. Several heavy-lift planes including the C-17 Globemaster are being put on standby for the evacuation efforts, they added. Prime Minister Narendra Modi has reportedly asked the IAF to join the evacuation efforts.

286.title: Maniesh Paul buys Mercedes worth over ₹1 crore, pics surface
286.article_body: Actor and TV host Maniesh Paul has bought a Mercedes GLS 400 worth over ₹1 crore. Some pictures and videos showed the 40-year-old and his wife and children stepping out of the recently-purchased car in Mumbai. Pictures of the actor purchasing the car have also been widely shared online.

287.title: Fans react to BCCI allowing 50% crowd for Kohli's 100th Test
287.article_body: After BCCI allowed 50% crowd in the stadium for Virat Kohli's 100th Test match in Mohali, a fan wrote on Twitter, "Viratians rule everywhere. We've won in the end." Another fan tweeted, "So happy to hear." Earlier, it was decided that the match will be held behind closed doors, however, the BCCI changed its decision after receiving widespread criticism.

288.title: Special court allows CBI to question Anil Deshmukh inside the jail
288.article_body: A special Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) court granted permission to the CBI to question Maharashtra’s former Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in the corruption case at the Arthur Road Jail in Mumbai. The court allowed CBI to carry electronic devices for recording Deshmukh's statement. Notably, Deshmukh is accused of corruption by former Mumbai Police Commissioner Param Bir Singh.

289.title: Always wanted to play Test series in Pakistan: Steve Smith
289.article_body: Australia Test vice-captain Steve Smith said he always wanted to play a Test series in Pakistan ahead of Australia's historic tour of the country after 24 years. "Because it's a challenge...finally we are getting that chance now," he added. The 32-year-old further said many Australians have come to Pakistan for first time and they're looking forward to some challenging cricket.

290.title: BJP workers attacked my convoy with sticks, stones: Ex-UP Minister
290.article_body: Former Uttar Pradesh Minister Swami Prasad Maurya, who is fighting the state assembly elections from the Fazilnagar constituency, said that BJP workers attacked his convoy with sticks and stones during electioneering. "My driver's ear got damaged. Many vehicles were damaged and hundreds of our workers were beaten up," he added. Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav condemned the attack.

291.title: Adidas suspends partnership with Russian Football Union amid Ukraine war
291.article_body: Adidas on Tuesday suspended its partnership with the Russian Football Union (RFU) with immediate effect due to Russia's invasion of Ukraine. This comes after FIFA suspended Russia from playing any international matches and banned domestic clubs from competing in UEFA competitions. Adidas has made the Russian national team kits for both the men's and women's teams since 2008.

292.title: 29 sugar mills closed, 11 sold at low rates during SP, BSP rule: Nadda
292.article_body: BJP president Jagat Prakash Nadda on Tuesday said that both Samajwadi Party and Bahujan Samaj Party closed 29 sugar mills in Uttar Pradesh and sold 11 mills at low prices. While addressing a rally in UP's Kushinagar, Nadda said, "Yogi's government gave a payment of ₹11,000 lakh crores to sugarcane growers."

293.title: India sending medicines to Ukraine, others sending bullets: Pradhan
293.article_body: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Tuesday said while India is sending medicines to Ukraine, other nations are sending bullets. Addressing a doctors' conference in Varanasi, the minister said India is sending medical help despite being worried about its citizens' safety. He termed it as India's "new identity" while adding that the country has become a superpower in the world.

294.title: Huge scope for Cong in TN, build foundation: Rahul to party members
294.article_body: Congress' Rahul Gandhi on Monday urged the newly elected party representatives of urban local bodies in Tamil Nadu to focus on building a strong foundation for Congress, adding that there's huge opportunity for growth. Gandhi further said that while the party is in alliance with Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) in the state, it's imperative for Congress to strengthen itself organisationally.

295.title: Spain to send 150 additional troops to Latvia after Ukraine invasion
295.article_body: The Spanish Defence Ministry on Tuesday said Spain will send an additional 150 troops to Latvia as part of a NATO buildup of battlegroups in the Baltic region following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Spain said it is increasing its number of reinforcement troops in Latvia in line with NATO response plans "to preserve peace and security after the invasion".

296.title: Cinema is a fantasy world, OTT won't give that experience: Yash
296.article_body: Kannada actor Yash has said he believes in entertaining his fans on the big screen despite the rising popularity of OTT platforms. "People need entertainment in cinemas, where it is a fantasy world. OTT [platforms]...will not give you that experience," he said. "You have to leave everything aside and go into a theatre...and...that world," he added.

297.title: SUV runs over devotees on Maha Shivratri in MP; 5 people injured
297.article_body: An SUV allegedly ran over a group of devotees who had come to a temple in the Bhind district of Madhya Pradesh on the occasion of Maha Shivratri. The incident left five of the devotees, including a child, injured. The driver was reportedly beaten up by people following the incident and the vehicle was vandalised.

298.title: At least 136 civilians killed, 400 others injured in Ukraine: UN
298.article_body: The United Nations Human Rights Office on Tuesday said at least 136 civilians, including 13 children, have been killed in Ukraine with 400 civilian injuries reported. "The real toll is likely to be much higher," said Liz Throssell, a spokesperson for the UN agency. The UN World Food Programme is increasing its activity to support up to 3.1 million Ukrainians.

299.title: World silent, history repeating: Ukraine Prez as 5 die after Russia bombs TV tower
299.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy posted a tweet after Russia bombed a TV tower in Kyiv, killing at least five people. He tweeted, "To the world: What's the point of saying "never again" for 80 years, if the world stays silent when a bomb drops on the same site of Babyn Yar?" He added, "At least five killed. History repeating."

300.title: Last 3 years have taken a toll on me: Gujarat Titans' ₹2-cr buy Roy on pulling out of IPL
300.article_body: Talking about pulling out of IPL 2022, Gujarat Titans' ₹2-crore buy Jason Roy released a statement, saying, "With everything going on in the world over the last 3 years it has added up and taken its toll on me." The 31-year-old English batter added, "I feel it is only right I spend some quality time with my family."

301.title: Ship with 4,000 cars including Porsches sinks 2 weeks after catching fire mid-ocean
301.article_body: A burnt-out cargo ship carrying around 4,000 cars made by Volkswagen Group, including Lamborghinis, Porsches, Bentleys and Audis, sank on Tuesday off the Portuguese Azores archipelago. The ship sank nearly two weeks after it caught fire mid-ocean. "When the towing started...water started to come in...The ship lost its stability and sank," the captain of the nearest port said.

302.title: 'New Girl' actor Ralph Ahn passes away at 95
302.article_body: Actor Ralph Ahn, who was best known for his role as Tran in TV series 'New Girl', has died at the age of 95. His career spanned over 65 years with credits such as 1950s shows 'Terry and the Pirates', '21 Beacon Street', among several others. "RIP. So much fun to work with," Ralph's former co-actor Jake Johnson said.

303.title: Give BJP govt 5 more years to bring peace in Manipur: Amit Shah
303.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday said that if voted to power, BJP "will take...steps for talks with the insurgency groups of Manipur to bring peace in the state". Shah added that BJP took similar initiatives in Tripura, and in the Bodoland and Karbi issues. He added that more than 9,500 persons associated with insurgency have given up arms.

304.title: Norway bans Russian alcohol from shops over invasion of Ukraine
304.article_body: Vinmonopolet, a state-owned alcoholic beverage retailer, said that its stores in Norway are removing Russian-made alcoholic beverages from their shelves in response to invasion of Ukraine. Notably, Vinmonopolet's shops are the only ones allowed to sell wine and hard liquor in Norway. Similar moves were announced in neighbouring Finland and Sweden, which also have state monopolies selling alcohol.

305.title: Lokomotiv Moscow manager resigns in protest against Ukraine invasion
305.article_body: Lokomotiv Moscow's manager Markus Gisdol on Tuesday said he has resigned from his position in protest against Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "I cannot pursue my calling in a country whose leader is responsible for a war of aggression in the middle of Europe," he said. The Russian club, however, stated he was dismissed. Gisdol oversaw 12 matches as manager.

306.title: 33 students from Tripura identified in Ukraine, 5 return home safely
306.article_body: Tripura Chief Secretary Kumar Alok, in a series of tweets on Tuesday, informed the public that total 33 students from the state have already been identified in Ukraine and their evacuation process is underway. In one of his posts, he wrote, "There's no need to worry about their safety." Five students from the state have reached India so far.

307.title: No Indian left in Kyiv, 60% Indians evacuated from Ukraine: Govt
307.article_body: Foreign Secretary Harsh Vardhan Shringla informed on Tuesday that all Indians have been evacuated from Kyiv, the capital of war-hit Ukraine. He said the government estimated that 20,000 Indians are in Ukraine and of them, 12,000 have been evacuated. Of the remaining 40%, most are in Kharkiv. India will operate 26 flights over next three days for evacuation, he added.

308.title: Mother-in-law once told Vipul 'Such a big director washing dishes': Shefali
308.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah has revealed her mother-in-law once saw her husband filmmaker Vipul Amrutlal Shah washing dishes and said, "Itna bada director bartan ghis raha hai (Such a big director is washing dishes)." Shefali added, "Vipul and I almost fell off laughing just hearing it. It was hilarious!" The actress further said he's as much a homemaker as she is.

309.title: Want to work with int'l musicians: Jalota on English song debut
309.article_body: After recording a track in English for the first time recently, singer Anup Jalota has said he wants to work with international musicians. "My students helped me get the accent and pronunciation right," he said. "I wish to do some work...in association with ISKCON. I want to record devotional songs in English," he added.

310.title: Shlipa Shetty shares first look of her upcoming film 'Sukhee'
310.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty on Tuesday unveiled the first poster of her upcoming film 'Sukhee'. In the first look, the actress can be seen holding various household items in her hands. "Thrilled to announce my next, in and as #Sukhee," Shilpa wrote in the caption of an Instagram post. The film is produced by Abundantia Entertainment and T-Series.

311.title: 6.6 lakh people have fled Ukraine since last week: UN agency
311.article_body: The UN refugee agency on Tuesday said that over 6.6 lakh people have fled Ukraine since the start of the Russian invasion last week. The situation looks set to become Europe's largest refugee crisis this century, it added. Some of the people arriving in Poland told UN field staff that they had waited for up to 60 hours to cross.

312.title: 'Sonchiriya' uplifted me as an actor and a human: Bhumi Pednekar
312.article_body: 'Sonchiriya', starring Sushant Singh Rajput, Bhumi Pednekar and Manoj Bajpayee, completed three years of its release on Tuesday. Taking to Instagram, Bhumi wrote, "A film that uplifted me as an actor and a human. Full of bittersweet memories. Some [of] that make me tear up even today." She posted a BTS video from the sets of the film on Instagram.

313.title: For 3 years, I was totally lost in my own sorrows: Bobby Deol
313.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol, speaking about his depressed phase, said that he was totally lost in his own sorrows for three years pitying himself. "Your family can support your whole life but they can't make you...go to work," the actor added. Bobby further spoke about nepotism, saying that a father in any industry can't help if his son fails.

314.title: Ukraine asks China to intervene to stop Russian invasion
314.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has asked his Chinese counterpart Wang Yi to use China's ties with Russia to stop the Russian invasion of Ukraine, the Ukrainian Foreign Ministry said on Tuesday. China is ready to make every effort to help end the war through diplomacy, Wang told Kuleba. China has strong trade links with Ukraine, according to Reuters.

315.title: 5 killed after Russian forces attack Kyiv's main TV tower, signals disrupted
315.article_body: The Russian forces on Tuesday attacked the main TV tower in Ukraine’s Kyiv, potentially disrupting its signal, said Ukrainian Interior Ministry adviser Anton Herashchenko. The attack reportedly claimed the lives of five people. The TV tower was situated near a memorial site that commemorates the victims of Babyn Yar, where thousands of Jews were killed by Nazis in 1941.

316.title: In pics: Damage caused by Russia's attack on Ukraine's 2nd largest city of Kharkiv
316.article_body: The Russian forces bombarded the central square in Ukraine's second-largest city of Kharkiv on Tuesday. As per an official, rocket strikes on Kharkiv killed at least 10 people and injured 35 others. On Tuesday, Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs also shared a video on Twitter of a Russian missile attack on the administrative building in Kharkiv.

317.title: Time pass rumour: Rashmika on reports of marrying Vijay Deverakonda
317.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna has refuted reports of marrying actor Vijay Deverakonda and called it a "time pass rumour". "I still have a lot of time for marriage. I will get married when the time comes. And for all those rumours written, I am like, let them be," she added. Some media reports had claimed the duo were getting married soon.

318.title: Delhi reports 344 COVID-19 cases, 4 deaths in last 24 hrs
318.article_body: Delhi reported 344 new COVID-19 cases and four related deaths in the last 24 hours, taking the overall infection tally in the city to 18,60,236. Moreover, 416 recoveries were reported in the national capital, with the city currently having 1,769 active cases. The city had reported 258 COVID-19 cases and no related death on Monday.

319.title: Sex racket running in Indore hotel busted, 15 members arrested
319.article_body: A crime branch team busted a sex racket running at a hotel in Indore, Madhya Pradesh, and arrested 15 people involved in it. Seven women and eight men were held after police raided the Rajputana Hotel in the Banganga area on Monday based on a tip-off. Police reportedly sealed all exit routes to bust the racket.

320.title: France to offer €100 mn in financial aid to Ukraine amid invasion
320.article_body: France will offer €100 million in financial aid to Ukraine amid ongoing Russian military offensive, French Foreign Ministry said on Tuesday. The aid, which comes in response to request by Ukraine, aims to relieve humanitarian crisis in country, ministry added. First shipment of 33 tonnes of aid, including sleeping bags and hygiene kits, was handed over to Ukraine on Monday.

321.title: Kashmir establishes helpline for students, residents stuck in Ukraine
321.article_body: The Divisional Administration Kashmir has established a helpline for residents or students of Kashmir who have been stranded in Ukraine. It was issued on Tuesday to provide the Kashmiri residents assistance from government. According to the administration, the concerned and their family members can contact on phone numbers, 01942457312 and 01942473135, in case help is needed from government.

322.title: After 14 years in custody, SC grants bail to a murder case convict
322.article_body: The Supreme Court has granted bail to a convict, Ritu Pal, in a murder case after observing that he has spent over 14 years in jail. The bench headed by CJI NV Ramana observed that Pal has undergone "about 17 years of total custody with remission". Notably, Pal's bail plea had been pending in the Allahabad High Court since 2012.

323.title: AFSPA extended for another 6 months in Assam
323.article_body: The Assam government on Tuesday extended the Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act, 1958 (AFSPA) for another six months with effect from February 28. An official statement said that the AFSPA was extended after reviewing the law and order situation in Assam in the past six months. The state has been declared a "disturbed area" for up to six months.

324.title: 26 flights scheduled to bring back Indians from Ukraine over next 3 days: Govt
324.article_body: Foreign Secretary Harsh Vardhan Shringla on Tuesday said that 26 flights have been scheduled over the next three days to bring Indian citizens who have moved from Ukraine to the neighbouring countries. Apart from Bucharest and Budapest, airports in Poland and Slovakia will also be used, he added. Around 12,000 Indian students out of 20,000 have left Ukraine, he stated.

325.title: Putin's a fu****g animal, wish he was dead like Hitler: Howard Stern
325.article_body: American radio personality Howard Stern criticised Russian President Vladimir Putin for launching an invasion into Ukraine. Howard also questioned the ex-US President Donald Trump praising Putin and called the Russian President a "fu****g animal." He further added, "I wish he was dead like I wish Hitler was dead." Howard also called Putin a s*****g who would enslave an entire country.

326.title: Don't think captaincy was ever a burden on Kohli: Gavaskar
326.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said that Virat Kohli was never affected by the burden of captaincy as he was scoring hundreds just every other innings. "As a captain what happens is that you are concerned about everybody else. It's just a natural thing," he stated. India-Sri Lanka first Test in Mohali will mark 100th Test for Kohli.

327.title: Communal polarisation only weapon left with BJP to win polls: Yechury
327.article_body: Communist Party of India (Marxist) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury has said that communal polarisation is the only weapon left with the BJP to win the elections. He said, "Instead of addressing the problem of the people the only focus of the BJP is to sharpen communal polarisation." Yechury said the country is witnessing a "systematic assault of the Indian Constitution".

328.title: Assam Police seize heroin worth ₹4 cr, drug peddler injured in firing
328.article_body: Assam Police shot at a drug peddler when he reportedly tried to escape and seized heroin worth ₹4 crores from his possession, police said on Tuesday. The peddler was stopped at the Jagiroad police checkpoint around 9 pm on Monday, Morigaon district Superintendent of Police Aparna N said. The accused was later shifted to Gauhati Medical College and Hospital.

329.title: Russian planes rerouted after attempting to enter Canadian airspace
329.article_body: Canadian air-traffic control service, NAV CANADA said two Russian planes which were attempting to enter Canadian airspace on Monday were rerouted by US' Federal Aviation Administration after the planes identified themselves as "humanitarian flights". This comes as Canada banned all Russian planes from its airspace on February 27 as part of sanctions on Russia due to its invasion of Ukraine.

330.title: Russian invasion of Ukraine is 'brutal aggression': Prince Charles
330.article_body: Prince Charles, heir to British throne, has called Russian invasion of Ukraine a "brutal aggression" and expressed solidarity with Ukrainians who are resisting the attack. The Russian assault represents an unconscionable attack on democracy and freedom, he added. Prince Charles' son William and his wife Kate also said earlier that they stood with Ukrainians as they "bravely fight" against Russia.

331.title: 24-yr-old man arrested with smack worth ₹1 crore in Rajasthan
331.article_body: A 24-year-old man was arrested after being found in possession of 600 gm of smack worth ₹1 crore in the international market, police said on Tuesday. The accused was found hiding the drug in his bag during a routine checking of a Rajasthan Roadways bus, in which he was travelling from Udaipur to Sanchore, police said.

332.title: Conditions not alien to me: Bumrah on preparing for home Test series vs SL
332.article_body: Asked about his preparations for upcoming home Test series against Sri Lanka, India Test vice-captain Jasprit Bumrah said conditions are not alien to him as he has played a lot of Ranji Trophy cricket. "It's always a special feeling to play Test cricket, be it anywhere...it's all about endurance and patience," he added. First Test begins on Friday in Mohali.

333.title: Australian PM Scott Morrison tests positive for COVID-19
333.article_body: Australian PM Scott Morrison on Tuesday said he has tested positive for COVID-19. "I am experiencing flu-like symptoms and will be recovering over next week," Morrison stated. He added he will continue with his official duties in isolation. Earlier on Tuesday, Morrison held a news briefing with Defence Minister Peter Dutton over military aid to Ukraine amid war with Russia.

334.title: Tamil Nadu CM launches skill development scheme for students
334.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Tuesday launched a skill development scheme for students in the state. The scheme aims to hone the educational skills and knowledge of 10 lakh youth annually and is titled 'Naan Muthalvan' (I am first). With the launch coinciding with his birthday, Stalin described the initiative as his dream scheme.

335.title: Maha to see if it can provide medical education like Ukraine, Russia
335.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Amit Deshmukh on Tuesday said the state government has taken note of the fee structures for medical education in Russia and Ukraine. He added that officials have been asked to see if such facilities can be provided to students in the state. Deshmukh said the government will study the reasons for students travelling abroad for education.

336.title: Adani Group forays into media business with minority stake in Quintillion
336.article_body: Adani Group will acquire a minority stake in Quintillion Business Media (QBM) Private Limited as it ventures in the news industry. A joint statement by the two companies said their relationship "marks a strong beginning of Adani Group's foray into Indian media". The deal is only limited to QBM and not any other products of QBM's parent company Quint.

337.title: Efforts on till all students are brought back from Ukraine: Mandaviya
337.article_body: Union Health Minister Dr Mansukh Mandaviya welcomed the Indian students at Delhi airport on Tuesday and said the government's efforts to repatriate stranded students will continue till all of them are brought back. "Many of your friends are still stuck in Ukraine, tell them efforts are being made to bring them back home," he further said.

338.title: BJP providing 24-hour electricity as SP built power plants: Akhilesh
338.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday said BJP is "able to give electricity for 24 hours only because [SP] had set up electricity plants". "BJP has sold airports, aeroplanes, railway stations. They're doing it so that no one gets employment," Yadav said. He added that instead of doubling farmers' income, BJP "stole the urea" meant for them.

339.title: 4 men rape minor after getting her addicted to drugs in Chennai; held
339.article_body: Four men have been arrested for allegedly repeatedly raping a minor girl after getting her addicted to drugs in Chennai. The girl, reportedly a Class 8 student, got addicted to cannabis after one of the accused befriended her and introduced it to her. The accused were reportedly identified as college students Vasanth and Vishal, Rejith and college lecturer Prasanna.

340.title: 440 killed in violence in South Sudan's Tambura last year: UN
340.article_body: The UN in a report said that at least 440 people were killed in violence between warring parties in South Sudan's Tambura between June and September last year. The violence was allegedly instigated, facilitated and aided by high-ranking military officials and community and religious leaders, it added. Some 80,000 people were forced to flee their homes, it further said.

341.title: Ukrainian journalist breaks down before UK's PM, says 'You are afraid'
341.article_body: Ukrainian journalist Daria Kaleniuk broke down before UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson while urging him to do more amid the Russian invasion of Ukraine, and said, "You're not coming to Kyiv or Lviv because you are afraid!" She added, "Because NATO is not willing to defend. Because NATO is afraid of World War 3 - but it has already started."

342.title: Joy of being an actor: Shefali on playing Akshay's mother in her 20s
342.article_body: Talking about playing the role of Akshay Kumar's mother in the 2005 film 'Waqt: The Race Against Time', Shefali Shah said, "Joy of being an actor, is...you play the roles...you're not." Shefali stated she did 'Waqt' so she could work with Amitabh Bachchan and her husband Vipul Amrutlal Shah. Shefali was 28 years old when she accepted the role.

343.title: Cong couldn't bring an AIIMS to Manipur in 15 yrs: Amit Shah
343.article_body: While addressing a rally in Manipur's Thoubal, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that Congress couldn't bring an All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) to Manipur in 15 years. "We have announced to build an AIIMS as soon as we form the government again," he added. Shah said that BJP has been working for the growth of Manipur's economy.

344.title: Southampton boss Hasenhuttl says tough to focus on football amid war
344.article_body: Southampton manager Ralph Hasenhuttl said the invasion of Ukraine by Russia "affects us all", adding it has been tough to focus on his job as a football manager amid the ongoing war. Southampton host West Ham United in the FA Cup on Wednesday. "It's a human catastrophe what happens and every team has players that are affected," he said.

345.title: Reliance buys majority stake in designer brand Abraham & Thakore
345.article_body: Reliance Retail on Tuesday announced it has acquired a majority stake in designer brand Abraham & Thakore (A&T) for an undisclosed amount. A&T's founders Rakesh Thakore, Kevin Nigli and David Abraham will continue to lead the creative direction of the brand, the company said. Reliance has recently invested in several designer labels including Ritu Kumar and Manish Malhotra's companies.

346.title: I am as strong in real life as on the field: Babita on 'Lock Upp'
346.article_body: Talking about her show 'Lock Upp', wrestler Babita Phogat has said that it'll be the first time that people will witness her real self. "Jaisi dhakad khel ke maidan mein hu, waise hi real mein bhi hu (I'm as strong in real life as on the field)," she added. Poonam Pandey and Munawar Faruqui are among the other contestants.

347.title: Ukraine releases instructions on safest places to hide at home; shares pic
347.article_body: Ukraine on Tuesday tweeted instructions for people in the country about the safest places in their houses amid Russian invasion. "A place behind two blank walls (the first takes the blow, the second blocks the wreckage). Room without windows (bathroom, if there is no gas equipment)," it stated. It added that windows must be shut tightly and sealed with film.

348.title: 616 Indians return from Ukraine on IndiGo, Air India Express flights
