348.article_body: As many as 616 Indian nationals who were stranded in Ukraine returned to India on three evacuation flights from Romania's capital Bucharest and Hungary's Budapest on Tuesday. Two of the flights were operated by IndiGo, while one was run by Air India Express. The Indian Embassy in Ukraine advised all Indian nationals to leave Kyiv urgently on Tuesday itself.

349.title: Russian music conductor fired by Munich over support for Putin
349.article_body: The city of Munich announced on Tuesday that it has fired Valery Gergiev as the chief conductor of the city's philharmonic orchestra over his support for Russian President Vladimir Putin. Gergiev has also been dropped as conductor of the Verbier Festival, the Edinburgh International Festival, the Vienna Philharmonic's five-concert US tour among other engagements amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

350.title: 'Bhagwa' is identity of 'Bhartiyata' & India's energy: UP CM Yogi
350.article_body: Addressing the public during a roadshow in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur, Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath said, "This 'Bhagwa' is the identity of 'Bhartiyata' [Indianness] and India's energy." The CM said, "I feel proud after wearing it because Swami Vivekananda had worn his 'Bhagwa' on the international stage...but some people are targeting Bhagwa." The BJP has fielded Yogi Adityanath from Gorakhpur.

351.title: Switzerland breaks 207-yr-old policy of neutrality to impose sanctions on Russia
351.article_body: Switzerland has broken away from its long-standing policy of neutrality after 207 years and agreed to adopt all the sanctions that the EU has imposed on Russia, due to its invasion of Ukraine. Accordingly, the Swiss assets of certain Russian people and companies will be frozen. "We're in an extraordinary situation where extraordinary measures could be decided," said Swiss President.

352.title: Ranveer Singh meets fan with his face tattooed on back, says 'Wow'
352.article_body: A video is going viral on social media showing actor Ranveer Singh meeting a fan who got his face tattooed on his back. Ranveer can be heard saying "Kya baat (Wow)" after seeing the tattoo. The fan said that he has been waiting a year to meet the actor, to which Ranveer replied, "Chalo mil gaye (We've met now)."

353.title: Doubles match vs Nielsen will be tough: Bopanna ahead of Davis Cup
353.article_body: Ahead of India's Davis Cup World Group-I playoff tie against Denmark, doubles player Rohan Bopanna said the doubles match is going to be a tough one. He added that Denmark team's captain Frederik Nielsen is an "extremely fantastic doubles player" and brings in a lot of experience. The tournament will be played on March 4-5 at Delhi Gymkhana Club.

354.title: Poland refuses to send fighter jets to Ukraine amid war with Russia
354.article_body: Poland President Andrzej Duda on Tuesday said Poland won't send fighter jets to Ukraine amid war with Russia. "We are not sending any jets to Ukraine because that would open a military interference in Ukrainian conflict," added Duda. Duda added NATO is not a party to the conflict. However, he said Poland has been supporting Ukraine with humanitarian aid.

355.title: 11 people killed in fire at mall in Syria's Damascus
355.article_body: At least 11 people were killed in a fire at a mall in Syria's capital Damascus on Tuesday, the Syrian Interior Ministry said. The fire caused significant damage and investigations to find out the cause are underway, it added. Many of the victims were security guards or staff who were on duty overnight in the building, a senior official said.

356.title: Evacuate us: 66 Indian students stuck in southern Ukraine to govt
356.article_body: Sixty-six Indian students stuck at a hostel of Petro Mohyla Black Sea National University in southern Ukraine's Mykolaiv on Tuesday urged the Indian Embassy to evacuate them. "We don't have sufficient food and the weather has been very cold," one student said. He added one batch was evacuated but they are waiting for a bus to reach neighbouring Moldova.

357.title: Kohli's 100th Test not to be played behind closed doors, 50% crowd to be allowed
357.article_body: The upcoming India-Sri Lanka Test which will mark Virat Kohli's 100th Test will not be played behind closed doors, BCCI Secretary Jay Shah confirmed, reversing an earlier decision. Fans will be allowed in 50% capacity inside the IS Bindra Punjab Cricket Association (PCA) Stadium in Mohali, the state association confirmed. The match will begin on March 4.

358.title: Burkina Faso approves transition charter, to hold polls in 3 years
358.article_body: Burkina Faso's national conference on Tuesday approved a charter allowing a military-led transition period of three years before the country holds polls. Signed by Lieutenant-Colonel Paul-Henri Damiba, the military junta leader, the charter will establish a government of 25 ministers and a parliament of 71 members. In January, President Roch Kabore was ousted by a military coup led by Damiba.

359.title: Greece backs EU sanctions against Russia, will host Ukrainians: PM
359.article_body: Greece PM Kyriakos Mitsotakis told the parliament on Tuesday that the country supports European Union's (EU) sanctions against Russia and is ready to host Ukrainian refugees amid the invasion. "Greece was always on the right side of history...we are on the side of Ukraine, freedom and democracy," PM Mitsotakis said. Mitsotakis also called for enhanced defence cooperation among EU countries.

360.title: 3 US states to end mask mandates in schools after March 11
360.article_body: Governors of California, Oregon and Washington on Monday said their states will remove mask mandates in school after March 11. "As we learn to live with this virus, we must remain vigilant," Oregon Governor Kate Brown said. Similar moves were made by other states after US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) on Friday eased its indoor mask guidelines.

361.title: Arvind Kejriwal condoles death of Indian student killed in Ukraine
361.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday condoled the death of 21-year-old Indian medical student Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar, who died in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv. Kejriwal took to Twitter and said, "Feel terrible to hear this news. Prayers for his family." "Pray for the safety of all other Indians stranded and hope they will be back home soon," he tweeted.

362.title: Prez Kovind cancels visit to Serbia, Jamaica & Saint Vincent: Report
362.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind has reportedly cancelled his three-nation tour to Serbia, Jamaica and Saint Vincent and the Grenadines. The tour, which was scheduled to begin on Wednesday, was reportedly cancelled after President Kovind met Prime Minister Narendra Modi on the sidelines of an event at the Rashtrapati Bhavan. However, the Ministry of External Affairs is yet to confirm it.

363.title: Russia's Miranchuk holds his head down, refuses to celebrate goal in Serie A match
363.article_body: Russian forward Aleksei Miranchuk held his head down and refused to celebrate after scoring his club Atalanta's fourth goal in their 4-0 victory against Sampdoria in Serie A. Miranchuk's goal came hours after Russian national team was suspended from qualifying matches for the FIFA World Cup amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

364.title: Who is Olena Zelenska, wife of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy?
364.article_body: Ukraine's First Lady Olena Zelenska, 44, has studied architecture before she changed her profession to writing. She met Volodymyr Zelenskyy at a university where they both were students. They got married in 2003, after eight years of dating and have two children aged 17 and eight. Zelenska now works as a screenwriter for Studio Quarter 95, a Ukrainian production company.

365.title: I’m feeling in a good space: Steve Smith ahead of Pak Test series
365.article_body: Australia vice-captain Steve Smith on Tuesday said he is "feeling in a good space" ahead of the Test series against Pakistan, following a concussion he sustained last month. Australia will tour Pakistan for the first time since 1998. They will play three Tests, three ODIs and one T20I in Pakistan. "Getting accustomed to the conditions is really important," Smith said.

366.title: He is allowed to have a couple of bad games: Dimitar Berbatov on Ronaldo
366.article_body: Former Manchester United player Dimitar Berbatov has said ex-teammate Cristiano Ronaldo is "allowed to have a couple of bad games", as Ronaldo's recent form has led to one goal in 2022. "Everybody in United team needs to produce more, the standards should be a lot higher than they are," Berbatov said. Manchester United are fourth on the Premier League table.

367.title: Indian Navy performs skit depicting INS Jalashwa at Goa Carnival
367.article_body: The Indian Navy participated in the Goa Carnival in Vasco-da-Gama on Monday. The Navy presented a short skit and displayed a tableau depicting the amphibious ship INS Jalashwa used in the 'Operation Samudra Setu' to provide aid during the Covid-19 pandemic. The tableau also reflected the theme of the Navy Week 2021: 'Indian Navy - Combat Ready, Credible and Cohesive'.

368.title: No water tariff hike in Chandigarh this year: Mayor
368.article_body: Chandigarh Mayor Sarbjit Kaur Dhillon has assured there will be no increase in the city's water tariff in the coming fiscal year. "I...met the UT administrator and requested that the tariff be kept the same," she said during the General House meeting on Monday. "If needed, I will take along all...councillors to meet the administrator on the issue," she added.

369.title: Putin's tanks only bring suffering & destruction: German minister
369.article_body: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock on Monday said Russia’s invasion of Ukraine is a "terrible turning point", adding, "Putin’s tanks only bring suffering and destruction." Baerbock said Europe stands together to help Ukraine as “no one believes the propaganda” of Russian President Vladimir Putin. Baerbock added, "Putin’s tanks don’t bring water. Putin’s tanks definitely don’t bring peace."

370.title: Thousands of Australians told to evacuate homes due to heavy floods
370.article_body: Across Australia's southeast coast, thousands of people were ordered to evacuate their homes by Tuesday as the region experiences heavy rainfall and the worst flooding in decades. Police said at least nine people have died so far. Australia's Bureau of Meteorology said Sydney could receive on Tuesday up to 15 cm of rain within a six-hour period.

371.title: European Council chief talks to PM, condoles Indian student's death in Ukraine
371.article_body: European Council chief Charles Michel said on Tuesday that he spoke with PM Narendra Modi and expressed his condolences to the latter for the death of Indian student Naveen in Kharkiv. "European countries are wholeheartedly helping Indian citizens to evacuate from Ukraine," said Michel. The 21-year-old medical student from Karnataka lost his life in Russian shelling today.

372.title: Don't think Team India is fully prepared for 2022 T20 WC: Rajkumar
372.article_body: Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma has said Team India are not fully prepared for 2022 T20 World Cup in Australia, adding there's still a lot of preparation required. "Our best XI hasn't even played one or two times...once you play your XI, then only you'll come to know what are the shortcomings and where improvement is required," he added.

373.title: Medvedev becoming world no. 1 is a good thing for tennis: Amritraj
373.article_body: Former tennis player Prakash Amritraj said it is good for tennis that Daniil Medvedev is the new world number one. Amritraj added he does not believe another "Big 3" will be as dominant in the sport in the future. "This is a super exciting time for the men's game. I am all for it, I am super pumped," he said.

374.title: BJP govt washing its hands off India's job crisis: Sitaram Yechury
374.article_body: CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury on Tuesday accused the BJP of "washing its hands off" India's job crisis. Yechury's remark came in response to an interview of Union Home Minister Amit Shah, where latter reportedly said, 'Communists consider only government jobs as employment'. "Privatisation destroys job reservations...[It pushes] India back by centuries, economically and socially," Yechury added.

375.title: UP saw 700 riots under SP rule before 2017: UP CM Yogi Adityanath
375.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath has said the BJP government wants everyone's development, while Samajwadi Party's leadership and BSP only want their development. Addressing an election rally in Siddharthnagar, Yogi said that before 2017, UP reported 700 riots under the SP government and over 300 riots under the BSP government. However, no riot was reported under the BJP government, he added.

376.title: We have to make India 'Vishwa Guru': RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat
376.article_body: During a book launch event in Delhi, Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) chief Mohan Bhagwat on Tuesday said, "We have to make India stand before the world [and] we have to make it 'Vishwa Guru'." "If we want to build a reputation of India, then we'll have to establish its antiquity and the truth from ancient times till date," he added.

377.title: Uttarakhand's Kedarnath Temple to open for devotees on May 6
377.article_body: Portals of the Kedarnath Temple in Uttarakhand will be opened for devotees at 6.25 am on May 6. The date and timing were announced after a religious ceremony at Omkareshwar Temple on the occasion of Maha Shivaratri on Tuesday. The temple gates will be opened in 'Vrishchik Lagna', Badri-Kedar temple committee official Harish Gaud said.

378.title: Naveen postponed travel to India so that juniors weren't left behind: Friend
378.article_body: A friend of 21-year-old Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar, who died in shelling in Ukraine on Tuesday, said the latter had postponed his travel to India so that his juniors aren't left behind in the country. Amit Vaishyar said Naveen wanted to leave for India on Wednesday, instead of Monday, along with juniors who were less than a year old in Ukraine.

379.title: First batch of 32 Himachal students returns from war-hit Ukraine
379.article_body: The first batch of 32 students of Himachal Pradesh, who were stuck in war-torn Ukraine, landed in Delhi in a special flight on Sunday evening. The Himachal Pradesh government deployed buses to take the students back to their home districts. The returnees said the situation in Ukraine is grim, particularly in the main cities.

380.title: Australia committed $50 mn to fund lethal weapons for Ukraine: PM
380.article_body: Australian PM Scott Morrison on Tuesday announced that Australia has committed A$70 million (Over $50 million) to fund lethal defensive weapons for Ukraine. "We're talking missiles, we're talking ammunition, we're talking supporting them in their defence of their own homeland...and we will be doing that in partnership with NATO," Morrison said. The weapons would be delivered rapidly, he added.

381.title: I didn't recognise my voice in Doctor Strange 2 trailer: Patrick Stewart
381.article_body: Veteran actor Patrick Stewart, who portrays Professor X in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, has seemingly confirmed his cameo in upcoming film 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness'. "I actually didn't recognise my own voice [in the trailer]...I was astonished and all [audience] saw was the back of my shoulder and...my earlobe...But uh, it pleased me," the actor said.

382.title: Russia says Meta, Google should be held accountable for inciting war
382.article_body: The Russian Foreign Ministry on Tuesday said western technological giants like Meta Platforms Inc and Alphabet's Google should be held responsible for "inciting war", news agency Interfax reported. Russian communications agency Roskomnadzor also demanded an end to discrimination against Russian media in Europe. Google recently blocked Russian media outlet RT and other channels from monetising ads.

383.title: 2 realtors shot dead on Hyderabad outskirts, hunt on to nab killers
383.article_body: Two real estate businessmen have been shot dead on the outskirts of Hyderabad. Police said the city-based realtors, who were partners in business, were shot at by unidentified assailants on Tuesday. An official said that while one of them died on spot, the other was rushed to hospital and pronounced dead there. A search is on to nab the killers.

384.title: It's like massacre arranged by Mughals against Rajputs: Ukraine on Russian invasion
384.article_body: Amid Russia-Ukraine war, Ukrainian Ambassador Igor Polikha on Tuesday said, "It (Russian invasion) is like the massacre arranged by Mughals against Rajputs." "We are asking every time all influential world leaders, among them Modi Ji, to use every resource against Putin to stop bombing and shelling," he added. He also thanked India for starting humanitarian aid to Ukraine.

385.title: Manjrekar gets protection from arrest by Bombay HC in obscenity case
385.article_body: Bombay High Court has granted director-actor Mahesh Manjrekar protection from arrest in a case over the alleged shooting of obscene scenes involving minors in his Marathi film 'Nay Varan Bhat Loncha Kon Nay Koncha'. Earlier, an FIR was registered against the film's director Manjrekar and the team under the provisions of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act.

386.title: Civic poll violence in Bengal send out wrong message: TMC MP
386.article_body: Reacting to reports of violence amid civic body elections in Bengal, Trinamool Congress (TMC) MP Saugata Roy said that such incidents should have been avoided as they send "wrong message among masses". "We (TMC) will win based on...work done by us, there's no need for...violence," he added. As many as 108 municipalities in the state went to polls on Sunday.

387.title: Hyd Traffic Police offers discount on pending challans from March 1
387.article_body: A one-time discount on traffic challans pending against motorists is being offered by traffic police in Telangana to provide respite to vehicle owners. Hyderabad Traffic Police Joint Commissioner AV Ranganath said the decision was taken considering financial troubles faced by many due to the COVID-19 lockdowns in last two years. The discount will be applicable from March 1 to 31.

388.title: Second round of Russia-Ukraine talks to be held on March 2: Report
388.article_body: The second round of talks between Russia and Ukraine is planned for March 2, reported Russia’s TASS news agency. The first round of negotiations had taken place on the Ukrainian-Belarusian border near the Pripyat river on Monday. The meeting had ended conclusively while both sides said they would meet again in the coming days.

389.title: Shahid's sister Sanah to marry Mayank Pahwa in Mahabaleshwar: Report
389.article_body: Veteran actors Pankaj Kapur and Supriya Pathak's daughter and actor Shahid Kapoor's half-sister Sanah Kapur will get married to actors Manoj Pahwa and Seema Pahwa's son Mayank Pahwa on Wednesday in Mahabaleshwar, reported Pinkvilla. The report stated that the mehendi and sangeet functions were scheduled for Tuesday. Sanah and Mayank reportedly got engaged in January 2017.

390.title: PM Modi chairs 4th high-level meeting in 48 hrs on Ukraine crisis
390.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday chaired a high-level meeting on the Ukraine crisis after Russian invasion, the fourth such meeting to be held in the last 48 hours. The meeting was called after India confirmed that a 21-year-old Karnataka native, Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar, died in shelling in Ukraine. Earlier, PM Modi also spoke with Naveen's family and offered his condolences.

391.title: BJP MP meets family of Karnataka student killed in Ukraine
391.article_body: Shivkumar Udasi, BJP MP from Haveri in Karnataka, on Tuesday met with the family of Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar who died in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv amid the Russian invasion. "He was standing in the queue before a grocery shop when the Russian army fired at people," Naveen's friend said. "We'll try to bring his body to India," Karnataka CM said.

392.title: Interpreter breaks down while translating Ukrainian President's speech to EU
392.article_body: An interpreter for a news channel broke down and cried while translating Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's address to the European Parliament on Tuesday. CNN's interpreter is heard sniffling while translating Zelenskyy's speech detailing the deaths of children and the toll of the Russian invasion. "This is the price of freedom," the interpreter said while passing on Zelenskyy's message.

393.title: I'm glad Sanjay Kapoor is getting his due: Arjun on 'The Fame Game'
393.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor said he's excited to see his uncle and actor Sanjay Kapoor doing series like 'The Fame Game'. "From seeing 'Akhiyaan Milaoon Kabhi' (song in film 'Raja') as a kid to...seeing the show with Madhuri Dixit and Sanjay chachu, it's like life coming full circle for him," Arjun stated. Arjun added he's glad Sanjay is getting his due.

394.title: Extreme climate conditions can cause mental health issues: UN panel
394.article_body: UN's Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) report released on Monday said extreme climate conditions can cause mental health issues like anxiety, depression, acute traumatic stress etc. Citing some studies, report said mental health problems increased by 0.5% when average temperatures exceeded 30 degree celsius. It also found increased risk of suicide with rise in ambient temperature.

395.title: Germany aims to fulfil all power needs via renewable sources by 2035
395.article_body: Germany has aimed to fulfil all of its electricity needs through renewable sources by 2035, a government draft paper stated. According to the draft paper, the share of wind or solar power should reach 80% by 2030. This comes after government considered extending life-spans of coal and nuclear plants to cut dependency on Russian gas on February 27.

396.title: Indian embassy didn't reach out to students in Kharkiv: Father of Indian who died
396.article_body: The father of 21-year-old Naveen Shekarappa Gyanagoudar, a medical student from Karnataka who lost his life in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv, alleged that no one from the Indian Embassy reached out to stranded Indian students in Kharkiv. His uncle claimed that Naveen was killed when he stepped out of his bunker to exchange currency and fetch some food.

397.title: 100th Test another feather in Kohli's cap: Bumrah ahead of Mohali Test
397.article_body: Talking about ex-India captain Virat Kohli playing his 100th Test in Mohali against Sri Lanka, beginning Friday, India Test vice-captain Jasprit Bumrah said, "It's another feather in his (Kohli's) cap." He added, "It's always a special achievement for a player...it's a testimony to his hard-work, dedication." Notably, Bumrah made his Test debut under Kohli in 2018.

398.title: Will deny port call of US sanctioned Russian oil tanker: Malaysia
398.article_body: Malaysian government on Tuesday said Russian-flagged oil tanker, Linda which was targeted by US sanctions will not be allowed to call at Kuala Linggi port. "The government will continue to review the situation for further action as may be required according to current government policies," the transport ministry added. However, the authorities didn't state government's position on US sanctions.

399.title: Pakistan logs 861 new COVID-19 cases, 18 deaths in last 24 hours
399.article_body: Pakistani authorities on Tuesday said the country reported 861 new daily COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours. As per Pakistan's National Command and Operation Centre (NCOC), 18 new deaths were recorded taking total death toll to over 30,000. NCOC added out of 37,087 active cases, 988 patients were critical. Meanwhile, positivity rate has dropped to 2.29% from 2.56%.

400.title: Ensure no more lives are lost in Russia-Ukraine conflict: J'khand CM
400.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren on Tuesday said that he is "deeply saddened" after Naveen Gyanagoudar, an Indian student, was killed in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv. CM Soren said, "Our thoughts and prayers are with the family members of the deceased student." He further urged PM Narendra Modi to ensure that no more lives are lost in the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict.

401.title: What is Wagner Group, the Russian mercenaries said to be in Kyiv to kill Ukraine Prez?
401.article_body: Mercenaries from Wagner Group, a Russian private military company recently sanctioned by EU over human rights abuses, are reportedly in Kyiv to assassinate Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. The company is believed to be used by Kremlin to carry out its strategic objectives, even though Russia denied such claims. Wagner was reportedly involved in beheading of Syria army deserters in 2017.
